24.7: 8. Instead of Abel because Cain killed him. All three sons are recalled in this verse, as if to summarize at the end of the section the entire episode very briefly.

5.3: Kush It would be difficult to associate this Kush with the well-known Kush dwelling to the south of Egypt, or with the Kushites that ruled over south Mesopotamia for a lengthy period of time during the second half of the second century BCE. It is more probable that the reference is to western Semitic tribes described as Kwshhw in the second collection of Egyptian execration texts which date back to the second half of the nineteenth century BCE. It appears that these tribes dwelled in the south of the land of Israel or of Jordan and were eventually absorbed by Midian (compare, a Kushite woman, in Numbers 12:1; and the mention of Kushan parallel to Midian in Habakkuk 3:7).
